1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver

2.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
near, with or among; often in general, to
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
properly, to run with asparkle, i.e. flow; hence (transitively), to conduct, and (by inference) to protect, sustain

4.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence

to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.

to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb

near, with or among; often in general, to

figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
enlargement, either literally (an open space, usually in a good sense), or figuratively (liberty)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare

a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
